data.question: What are coordination polymers also known as?
data.answer: Metal–organic frameworks (MOFs)

data.question: What method was reported for organizing coordination polymers on solid surfaces?
data.answer: Deposition from vapor phase on a substrate of oligomeric species obtained by direct sublimation of a bulk MOF in vacuum.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n has a 2D symmetry.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the role of hydrogen bonds in the structure of {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n?
data.answer: Hydrogen bonds interconnect individual [Co(ox)(Htr)2] chains to the nearest four chains.

data.question: True or False: The sublimation method produces fibers with more homogeneous width distributions compared to those prepared from solutions.
data.answer: True

data.question: What happens to the {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n polymer when it is annealed at 423 K?
data.answer: It is sublimated to produce oligomeric species that are then deposited on surfaces.

data.question: What property does the [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n polymer have that suggests its potential use as a molecular wire?
data.answer: It behaves as a metallic electrical conductor at room temperature.

data.question: True or False: The [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n polymer forms 1D structures when adsorbed on a mica substrate at room temperature.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the effect of increasing the sublimation time on the fibers formed on surfaces?
data.answer: The width, height, and length of the fibers tend to increase while retaining its longitudinal aspect ratio.

data.question: True or False: The sublimation/adsorption process for both {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n and [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n polymers is reversible.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the base pressure used for the sublimation of both coordination polymers?
data.answer: 1 (cid:2) 10(cid:3)6 mbar

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of coordination polymers on a surface by S. Stepanow et al. uses a different mechanism than the one described for the sublimation method.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the binding energies for the coordination bonds in the [Pt2(n-butylCS2)4I]n polymer?
data.answer: The binding energies indicate that the polymer sublimates through fragmentation of the weak Pt–I bonds.

data.question: True or False: The fibers obtained by sublimation are not preferentially aligned along in-plane directions on the substrate.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of kinetics in the nanostructuration of metal–organic materials on surfaces?
data.answer: Kinetics plays a key role in the nanostructuration of metal–organic materials on surfaces.

data.question: True or False: The method for preparing MOFs on solid surfaces is complex and requires specialized equipment.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the main advantage of the sublimation method over deposition from solution?
data.answer: The sublimation method produces cleaner and well-ordered MOFs at the atomic level.

data.question: How does the substrate temperature affect the morphology of the polymers deposited on mica?
data.answer: Deposition at 393 K produces fibers that reflect the 1D symmetry of the MOF bulk, unlike adsorption at RT which leads to 3D islands.

data.question: True or False: The coordination polymer {[Co(ox)(Htr)2] (cid:1) 2H2O}n is synthesized using a home-made procedure.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of the substrate's properties on the organization of coordination polymers?
data.answer: The substrate's properties, such as being conductive or insulating, affect the morphology and organization of the deposited coordination polymers.
